de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.network
Interface NetLayer

All Superinterfaces:
Component
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractNetLayer, GnpNetLayer, SimpleNetLayer
public interface NetLayer
extends Component

The NetLayer provides a general interface to encapsulate various networking models. This way, it is possible to use network solutions with different abstraction levels and complexity. For instance, one can chose either between a lightweight simple implementation which offers an adequate model with minimum demands in resource requirements and a more complex implementation capable to model fairshare bandwidth allocation of TCP but having a lot of CPU consumption.

Version:
3.0, 11/29/2007
Author:
Sebastian Kaune, Konstantin Pussep

Method Detail

send

void send(Message msg,
          NetID receiver,
          NetProtocol protocol)
Deliver a message with the given data to the destination using the given network protocol such as IPv4.

Parameters:
msg - the msg to be sent
receiver - the remote receiver
protocol - the used network protocol

isOnline

boolean isOnline()
Returns whether the network layer has connectivity to the physical network.

Returns:
return true if the network layer has connectivity to the physical network

isOffline

boolean isOffline()
Returns whether the network layer has connectivity to the physical network.

Returns:
return true if the network layer does not have connectivity to the physical network

getNetID

NetID getNetID()
Returns the NetID of a NetLayer instance

Returns:
the NetID of a given NetLayer instance

goOnline

void goOnline()
Establishes the connection to the physical network. Further to this, if installed, the correspondent ConnectivityListener will be informed about the changes in connectivity.

goOffline

void goOffline()
Releases the connection to the physical network. Further to this, if installed, the correspondent ConnectivityListener will be informed about the changes in connectivity.

getNetPosition

NetPosition getNetPosition()
Returns the NetPosition of a host which might be represented as the position in a two-dimensional Euclidean space, as n-dimensional coordinates used in Global Network Positioning or the location on Earth which is described by two numbers--its latitude and its longitude.

Returns:
NetPosition the appropriate position

getMaxUploadBandwidth

double getMaxUploadBandwidth()
Returns the maximum physical upload bandwidth that is available at the given network wrapper. Thus, this value represents a state in which all upload connections are closed.

Returns:
the maximum physical upload bandwidth

getCurrentUploadBandwidth

double getCurrentUploadBandwidth()
Returns the current available upload bandwidth of the network layer as the maximum upload bandwidth might be shared between concurrently established connections.

Returns:
the available upload bandwidth

getMaxDownloadBandwidth

double getMaxDownloadBandwidth()
Returns the maximum physical upload bandwidth that is available at the given network wrapper. Thus, this value represents a state in which all download connections are closed.

Returns:
the maximum physicalupload download bandwidth

getCurrentDownloadBandwidth

double getCurrentDownloadBandwidth()
Returns the current available download bandwidth of the network layer as the maximum download bandwidth might be shared between concurrently established connections.

Returns:
the available download bandwidth

addConnectivityListener

void addConnectivityListener(ConnectivityListener listener)
Adds a connectivity listener to a given NetLayer instance. This should be automatically managed by the HostBuilder and the listener should be a subclass of the HostProperties interface.

Parameters:
listener - the connectivity listener

removeConnectivityListener

void removeConnectivityListener(ConnectivityListener listener)
Removes the installed connectivity listener.

Parameters:
listener - the connectivity listener to be removed
